alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Fluvanna (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 4:50PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Cumberland and south central Fluvanna Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 450 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Dillwyn, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cartersville, Fork Union, Columbia, Lakeside Village, Duncan, Dixie, Trents Mill, Ashby, Bremo Bluff, Tamworth, Cohasset, Whiteville, Bear Creek Lake State Park, Trenton Mills and Shores. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
